full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement

#### **Project Title**

Advancing Carbon Accounting for Quality Data in the Cement Industry

#### **Reference and Solicitation Number**

* Reference Number: cb-669-17156207
* Solicitation Number: 24-58016

#### **Tender Status and Closing Date**

* Tender Status: Expired
* Tender Closing Date: 2024-06-04T14:00:00 (UTC)

#### **Expected Contract Details**

* Expected Contract Start Date: 2024-06-14
* Expected Contract End Date: 2025-03-31

#### **Procurement Details**

* UNSPSC: 81141704, *Production statistics collection or analysis services*
* Procurement Method: Competitive - Open Bidding
* Selection Criteria: Not Applicable
* Trade Agreements: applicable to several countries, as listed below:
	+ Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
	+ World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
	+ Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
	+ Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
	+ Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
	+ Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
	+ Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA)
	+ Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
	+ Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
	+ Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
	+ Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)
	+ Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)

#### **Geographic Scope**

* Regions of Opportunity: Canada
* Regions of Delivery: Ottawa, Ontario

#### **Contracting Entity and Contact Information**

* Contracting Entity: National Research Council Canada
* Contact Person: Stéphane Lajoie, stephane.lajoie@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca, (514) 210-7395

#### **Notice and Attachments**

* Notice type: Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN)
* Attachments: available for download on the Canada Buys website ([link](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/38539/24-58016_acan_cementassociationofcanada.pdf))

#### **Project Description**

The National Research Council of Canada is seeking to advance carbon accounting for quality data in the cement industry. As part of the LCBE Challenge program, a Canadian
